decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s):  1998/2/101 B (Proposed Drawing / Loft: Elevations / Site Plan & Section A-A & B-B) and 1998/2/102B (Proposed Drawing / Loft: Floor Plans)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match that of the existing dwelling and as per approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) - Section 12
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the approved development.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) - Section 12.

| The hereby approved rooflight to the front roof slope of the hereby approved development shall not project more than 150mm from the plane of the roof slope when measured perpendicularly and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the design harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies HC1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies, HC1, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg18), Brunswick Conservation Area management plan and Ealing's Generic Management Plan for Conservation Areas (2023)
| The hereby approved side facing windows to the second floor east elevation shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of the host site in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.18) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012).
description: Alteration of roof from hip to gable end to main roof slope and rear roof extension with Juliet Balcony and installation of front roof light
